Dear Ms. Limbaugh:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 02/15/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.
Sincerely,
Christopher M Barr, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications
(1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671 shall
not permit a child caring institution staff member to
begin working unless all of the following has been
completed using the forms, and in the manner,
prescribed by the department:
(a) A criminal record check as referenced in R
400.4113(f), including a fingerprintbased check of
national crime information databases, unless an
alternative criminal history check has been approved by
the federal government.
One out of four new hire records reviewed did not contain an ICHAT at time of
hire. The employee started employment on 06/21/2022, whereas the ICHAT was
completed on 01/31/2023. The facility reports the initial ICHAT being completed
though misplaced.
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and
date an updated treatment plan for each resident at
least once every 90-calendar days following the initial
treatment plan.
Three out of three case records reviewed contained late service plans by two
days each. It is noted that service plan timeframes were calculated by using the
same numbered day, three months from the time the last service plan was
completed, rather than calculating the time frame from 90-days. It is also noted
that the service plan end date and the start date for the new service plan time
period was the same date rather than starting a new date.

CCI Rule 400.4144 Admission health screening; physical examinations.
(1) An initial health screening shall be completed for
each resident within 24 hours of admission to a facility.
One out of three case records reviewed was deficient an initial health screen.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance

period under review.

through 06/2021 indicates operational compliance.
PREA compliance (if applicable) N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment Assessment period 01/01/2022 through
12/01/2022 indicates the facility is in the process of making their part-time business
and programs managers to full time to address consistencies and establish regular
reviews.
Staff and Youth Interviews Staff report being supported and valued by
administration. Youths report feeling safe, supported, and are provided with much
enrichment activities.

Description of Agency Walk Through Facility is clean and orderly. No hazards are
noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
